üëë Fighters

‚Ü©Ô∏è

On June 17 2023, UFC 289 took place in Vancouver, Canada. All Canadian fighters performed perfectly and ended as 6-0. The main event was the lion Amanda Nunes versus Irene Aldana. The undisputed two-division champion won the match dominantly. As a matter of fact, I picked the latter, but Irene didn‚Äôt even show her strike skills very much, she had to face the force and push from the champion. After the unsuspicious decision was read out, the UFC female queen took off the gloves and made a speech to the entire world. She‚Äôs been a fighter for so many years, now she retires as a GOAT. She got the family and a girl by side and it‚Äôs pretty enough.
The comain even was between Charles 'DoBronxs' Oliveira

An surprising and explosive accident happened on June 24, 2023, due to the unpleased manner to Russia‚Äôs Ministry of National Defense, the leader of the world most prominent mercenary army Wagner, Mr. Prigozhin, decided to attack the capital Moscow to protest. Specifically Russia‚Äôs MND was willing to incorporate mercenaries into the national army which is unfavorable for Wagner. This breaking news actually happened and ended soon with a peaceful result that the president of the Republic of Belarus Lukashenko stepped in and confirmed Prigozhin arrival in Belarus, said Wagnerites "welcome to stay here for a while, at their own expense of course". Of course, this implausible thriller looks even more surreal when you remember how he freaked out the first time Wagnerites showed up in Belarus.

‚òÄÔ∏èTREBLE WINNERs

‚Ü©Ô∏è


‰∏çËØ¥ÂæàÈöæÂèóÔºå‰ΩÜ‰πüËßâÂæó ‰ºöÊúâÁßØÊûÅÊñπÈù¢ÁöÑÂèØËÉΩÔºå‰ΩÜÊòØË∂äËØ¥Ë∂äÊãñÂÖ•Ê∑±Ê∏ä Áã†Áã†Âú∞ÊíïÂºÄÁö≤Ë£ÇÁöÑ‰º§Âè£„ÄÇ


'loyalty'

I got, I got, I got, I got
Loyalty, got royalty inside my DNA

ËôΩÁÑ∂‰∏çÂñúÊ¨¢ËøôÊ†∑Ôºå‰ΩÜÊòØËøòÊòØ‰ºöËá™Â∑±Âøç‰∏ç‰ΩèÁ¨ë ÂìàÂìàÂìàÂìà Team Chandler leads 6-0 versus Team McGregor. LOL

hard work pays off!!! we are again the champions!!

üò§wait but why

‚Ü©Ô∏è
I've always been doing this: a conclusive thought comes to my mind, and I try to gather as much evidence as I can to solve and describe it from all perspectives. I process this kind of thing while I'm riding my bike on my way to the canteen. Like this, Conor McGregor said in his documentary: I don't go to other places to learn from other coaches, cause you must trust your coaches, have confidence and believe their capability. In this case, I think Team Khabib is the same as Team Conor. I got a straightforward and smooth narrative in my mind nearly one hour ago, but unfortunately, I lost it. Now I possibly see it in the other way. The most important thing in fighting business is self-improvement, that's the real matter that helps you keep and defend the belt if you're a champion. What matters is what you do, rather than who coach you or how high the coaches' level are. You can learn anywhere, anyway. And of course, it takes sacrifices and pain.
Oh, I have it now: ask a quick question for Mr M, what's the name of two main parties in USA. He can't even anwser it quite straight.

üìùWriting a scientific article: A step-by-step guide for beginners

‚Ü©Ô∏è
A step-by-step guide for beginners

Even today, the old adage ‚Äúpublish or perish‚Äù remains valid.
However, the competition is already quite fierce amongst all the good quality papers that are submitted to journals, and it is therefore of paramount importance to get the basics right, in order for your paper to have a chance of succeeding.

  • softer tone
  • result show types: text table figure...

‚ò™Ô∏èNewsletter Scott Young-Why Learning Still Matters

‚Ü©Ô∏è
LINK

Whenever there's a new tech&product coming out, it always triggers a hot discussion on the internet. Mainly these days, people wonder whether it's necessary to learn languages "in person"? As a matter of fact, we've already used AI models to generate code for so many times, so is it vital that I could handle the code without AI? "One thing I am reasonably confident predicting, however, is that LLMs won‚Äôt make learning obsolete, " Scott Young wrote in the newsletter. He took paper writing and a calculator as examples. The saying goes, 'The palest ink is better than the best memory.' We no longer need to memorize speeches if the full text is written down. To some extent, our memory of the mind gets released. While they certainly eliminate the need to learn some skills (I have no idea how to use a slide rule, for instance), we still have to understand arithmetic to use a calculator to get the answer we seek, even if the machine does the actual computation.

Knowledge outside your head doesn‚Äôt count, since it can‚Äôt participate in learning and reasoning.
The ability to look something up is not a substitute for having knowledge in your head.
Understanding an LLM‚Äôs answer depends heavily on the knowledge you already possess.
Your own knowledge allows you to extract knowledge from the LLM more accurately.
LLMs may accelerate the need for knowledge, since the combination of [knowledgeable person + ChatGPT] will outperform [ignorant person + ChatGPT] by a wider margin than exists between the two people on their own.

From what I can see, like generating codes by ChatGPT, it'd be better if the users are capable of reading, finding out the errors and correcting the codes.
Wait but somehow all these products which are tokens as examples are not as epoch-making as LLMs. So we can barely see it that way. Or maybe LLMs are not that epoch-making yet, we all can just see it as a new-era tool. The larger and stronger-impact AI products are in the way...

Physical labour can be replaced by AI techs definitely. But even sophisticated enough tasks like chess have already been proven that can defeat in front of AI.

In the extreme case, all bets are off. Perhaps we‚Äôll live in a utopian future where machines do all the work and people do cognitive activities for leisure or showing off, much like gardening is a hobby, not agriculture. Or perhaps we‚Äôll all get turned into paperclips. Who knows?

üëë Fighters

‚Ü©Ô∏è

The UFC 288 fight card was built around one of the greatest bantamweight champions--Aljamain Sterling. The undisputed belt holder has already defended his crown twice against the former champions, Peter Yan and TJ Dillashaw. Domestically the fighting style of the division's current king is not much fond by fans. POV: relatively poor stand-up skills and boring ground style. But regardless, this third title defence leads him to the achievement that being the first-ever bantamweight champion successfully defend the title 3 times consecutively. The challenger, Henry Cejudo has already harvested all the reputation a man could in this business. This also reminds me of what Pep did to Erling Haaland when the latter almost got 5 goals in one champions league match. During the shower, I thought having too fruitful awards at an early age isn't that good to be a GOAT. 3C's performance was unbelievable and those TD were fabulous from all perspectives. Aljo took down 3C several times and the former two-division champion has only been taken down once!!! Physically Aljo has much more advantages over 3C in reach length and so on. All five rounds were extremely close, but as you may already be familiar with, it won't be easy for the challenger to take away the belt. So the split win for AS is acceptable personally. Hope 3C wouldn't retire after this, cause Branden Moreno has unfinished business with him and 3C's status is good to be a contender.

The co-main event was a potential title qualifier fight between Belal Muhammad and Gilbert Burns. It seems like Burns show every weekend on the fight nights, lol. A lot of respect for him. Belal landed many leg kicks to his rival's body and head in the early two rounds. Burns tried to block with his arms partially and his left arm was uncomfortable. So it's pretty tough for "Durinho" to harm his opponent heavily. In the end, Belal Muhammad Defeats Gilbert Burns by Decision. Much respect between both.

And China power!! Yan Xiaonan was patient, and smart with some moves and hurt J√©ssica Andrade at the beginning of the fight. While J√©ssica was chasing and aiming to land some shots, Yan dodged and take a right nuclear punch to J√©ssica's chin. Finally, Yan won by KO for the first time in her career. More importantly winning this contender fight give her a title short, namely Chinese Derby with Zhang Weili.


Besides, a lot of stuff happened this evening.LOL
Merab ‚ÄúHoudini‚Äù Dvalishvili too quick üòÇüòÇüòÇ . This man had O'Malley‚Äôs jacket on in 5 seconds üò≠ #UFC288

üëëüëëü•áTriple C

‚Ü©Ô∏è

üëëüëëü•á
36 years old??
I'm 36 years young.

Life is a dramatic story all about exploration. Maybe all we need to be successful is the timing to grasp the chances. It's not necessarily your whole lifetimeÔºå but certain ages around your twenties. Henry Cejudo won the Olympic gold medal in 2008 and retired from UFC as a two-division champion. BTW, the most impressive part is that with all these wars he's been through, he comes back only at 36. Today he returned for the UFC bantamweight belt which was never truly lost. Triple C lost the title fight by a split decision to Aljo Sterling, unfortunately. But okay, we trust the process! The walkout song (Lupe Fiasco - The Show Goes On) of the king reminds me of Sth. Take your time.

üìùStories never been told

‚Ü©Ô∏è
Back in middle school time, we all had a lot to say to each, but it seemed time was always not enough for us. Differently, these days we realistically do not have that many words to share. Miss you. It's unimaginable to me that the days I spent with you the last summer were the last chance to see you. Unfortunately, it could be the last meeting between us under the witness of this planet. Everything looked fine at that time. Hopefully, we could bond with each till the end in another parallel universe. You're cute and stunning.

Every morning, I remember that you're really gone
I think about you every day, nothing will take this pain away

üëë Fighters

‚Ü©Ô∏è

Before the unique fight week, I watched the walkout live videos of Israel Adesanya again and again, and a lot of complicated emotions and feelings came into my mind. I fell into the abyss of loneliness and fear. They inspired me to be the winner of the master in several wars, but it means too much. Like death staring at me at the gate of hell, the abyss of fear, helplessness and loneliness is of course for the challenger. Like the setting sun and the foreplay of endless darkness.

Never thought the rematch between Alex&Izzy would be this dramatically unimaginable. I got a lot of words to say before this historical event. The narratives behind the fights of this two are second to none, as taking a broad view of history and future. One is the two-division belts holder, the other's legacy doesn't even need words to mention, as exactly people commented "The Battle of Ending the Valley between Naruto and Sasuke". Personally, I'm awfully blessed to watch this main event. I was with 'Poatan', the reason behind this has nothing to do with religion. He's a quite hard-worker, a man only acts, like Leo Messi and many other greats. Btw, I unfollowed some IG accounts relating the Is***. Originally, a certain page posted that in XinJiang, some kids had been forcely locked into "concentration camps". I's like wtf??? Ignorance is the one true factor under this circumstance. Don't ever easily trust someone nowadays, even when it comes to sth you could never have a doubt about. A mouth full of shit. Back to UFC 287, the first of the main event is quite equally extensive. At the beginning of the second round, Perrira landed a couple of shots on Izzy, and let the latter went back and hands up to defend the head, and at this time, the champion kept landing shots, but suddenly Izzy fought back with a punch, which made Alex cannot stand still. What's coming next is the most savage shot which landed on the temple, and Consequently, the champion fell down to ground uncautiously. Na, the most entertaining part was not over, right after the stoppage by the referee, Izzy perfromed his celebration action by fetching and shooting three arrows from his back to where Alex layed. And the next part is the interview...

'''
As I said No f**king way!!!!!
This is beyond imagination, even for a movie.
LIVE IN THE MOMENT.
Go for sth.
Izzy Adesanya with the most inspirational speech of the year:

‚ÄúYou‚Äôll never feel this level of happiness if you don‚Äôt go for something‚Ä¶when they knock you down‚Ä¶.when they put their foot on your neck. If you stay down, you‚Äôll never get that resolve. Fortify your mind!‚Äù
justonetimeinyourlife
REVENGE IS SWEET

'''

‰Ω†ÂèØËÉΩ ËøòËÆ∞ÂæóÂπ¥ËΩªÁöÑÊó∂ÂÄôÊõæËøô‰πàÂπ≤Ëøá„ÄÇÈÇ£Êó∂Ôºå‰Ω†ÊúâÂ§ßÊääÁöÑÊó∂Èó¥ÂèØÁî®ÔºåÂîØ‰∏ÄÁöÑÊúüÈôêÂ∞±ÊòØ‰∏äÂ∫äÁù°ËßâÁöÑÊó∂Èó¥„ÄÇÈÇ£Êó∂Ôºå‰Ω†ÁöÑÊÉ≥Ë±°ÂäõÂèØ‰ª•Ëá™Áî±Âú∞È£û„ÄÇËÄå‰∏ÄÊó¶Êàë‰ª¨ÈïøÂ§ß‰∫ÜÔºåËøôÁßçÊº´Êó†ÁõÆÁöÑÁöÑÂÑøÊó∂‰πêË∂£‰ºöÂèòÂæóÊó†ËÅäËµ∑Êù•„ÄÇÊàë‰ª¨‰∏çÂÜçÊúâÊó∂Èó¥Êó†ÊâÄ‰∫ã‰∫ãÂú∞ÁõØÁùÄÂ§©Á©∫„ÄÅÁúã‰∫ëÂç∑‰∫ëËàí„ÄÇ

ËßÇ‰∫ëÊòØ‰∏ÄÁßçÂøÉÂ¢ÉÔºåËÄå‰∏çÊòØ‰∏ÄÈ°πËÆ°ÂàíÂ•ΩÁöÑÊ¥ªÂä®„ÄÇ

ÂΩìÂ§©Á©∫‰∏äÊºî‰∏ÄÂú∫Ë°®ÊºîÁßÄÊó∂Ôºå‰Ω†Âè™ÈúÄÊöÇÂÅúÊâãÂ§¥Ê≠£Âú®ÂÅöÁöÑ‰∫ãÔºåÂπ∂ÊäïÂÖ•ÂÖ∂‰∏≠Âá†ÂàÜÈíüÂ∞±ÂèØ‰ª•‰∫Ü„ÄÇ

Cirrus uncinus(Èí©Âç∑‰∫ë) is the one that impresses me the most. I wish I can take a photo of it next time. However, places like Shanghai, typically don't even let clouds show in the sky. So I barely have chances to capture these.

We finish what we started.

A day without a plan is awfully classless and wasteful.

I know I know. It doesn't matter. I'm from trenches. I'm built like this.
Âè≥ÁúºÁöÆÂ∑≤ÁªèÂÉèÊòØË∞ÉÁöÆÁöÑÂ≠©Â≠êÂú®Ëπ¶Â∫ä‰∏äÂ∞ΩÊÉÖÂú∞Ë∑≥Ë∑É‰∏ÄÊ†∑Ôºå‰∏çËÄêÁÉ¶Âú∞ÊèêÈÜíÊàëÂÅúÊ≠¢‰ΩøÁî®ÁúºÁùõ‰∫ÜÔºåOKOKÔºånightnight„ÄÇ
Feeling of dealing with the continuation calculation: you find a regular phenomenon, guess and summarize the law, and start to verify the law. The guess is constantly confirmed, and the conclusion is consolidated step by step, truth!

Blue moon
You saw me standing alone
Without a dream in my heart
Without a love of my own

[Verse 2]
Blue moon
You knew just what I was there for
You heard me saying a prayer for
Someone I really could care for

Shabba Madda Pot
Dexta Daps
Cutchy loud from inna Netherland
Wey the grabber stink like alligator pond
The scheme hot, today we a the weather man
A bwoy shoulda drop, but the Beretta jam
Long time we nuh kill a man
So we circle dem end‚Äôs like the letter man
Set a bomb, make a dam
Black rain fall, something must catch a man

üëë Fighters

‚Ü©Ô∏è

As half of a year in the making, the fight between Nigerian 'Nightmare' Kamaru Usman versus Leon 'Rocky' Edwards was held at The O2 arena in London, England. The audience put their attention mainly on 2 fights, namely co-main event and main event. The former one was between Justin 'Highlight' Gaethje and Rafael Fiziev. As we all know, Justin arguably is the most exciting performer to watch in this business nowadays, and his fighting style had earned him the most bonuses than anyone. His shows are always zealous for fans and newcomers to enjoy. Importantly, his opponent, Rafael Fiziev showed how nimble and technical he is in today's comain event. The newcomer of the lightweight division is tough and he can really take plenty of shots. To some extent, his speed may have something with his race, as Asian fighting out of Bishkek, Kyrgyzstan. The only pity for me is that his father told him if he win the game, the father would kill one sheep for the poor. I guess mainly the reason for that is Ramadan around the corner. Congrats to the brother and you can easily tell that next time, after some progress, he could get his hand raised in a title shot. No matter what comes, we just don't give up. Head up and come back ASAP.


Now on the main event, personally I can't see the influence of the headshot that the last time Leon landed on Kamaru left today. Leon showed his real level and tactics were carried out fabulously. More leg-kicks and excellent takedown defences made him retain the championship in the homecountry. The former champion didn't fight at that high level and his plans weren't selectively enough to help him get the belt back. Personally the coming fights I desired are Leon vs Colby, Kamaru vs the winner of the 'Belal vs Shavkat'. After the main fight, Kamaru said all the fighters went through a lot to be awfully prepared and perform for the fans. They definitely should get a reputation and respect. Shout out to heroes! They are fighters not only for the fans and sports but also for their family members, as a father, mother... Among the fighters, they got a lot of respect for each. Justin and Rafael showed their thoughts on that by tweeting 'It was an honour to share the cage'. Additionally, Justin is well educated by his parents and schools, and he acts and talks righteously at the same. This reminds me of the importance of knowledge and insights that humans have. Believably he has a love and wonderful family. There is something we can learn from outside the octagon. Almost forgot to say, Colby's fight is on the way. In the interview, he said he just doesn't like anyone else, who pictures the training and posts it on social media. He is bad in some ways, but you cannot deny that he's similar to big names like Leo Messi, and me. The elites do have something in common.

Life is f**king colorful for us to live in. We all fight together!

Till next , stay safe and stay hydrated!

üëë Fighters

‚Ü©Ô∏è

  • The Kazakhstanian fighter Shavkat Rakhmonov won over Jeff Neal via a rear naked choke. What a fabulous fight! My pick for fight of the night. Hats off to both men with their own unstoppable wills. Shavkat! 17 stoppages in a row!
  • Alexa Grasso took a back and held a positon to choke Valentina Shevchenko after the latter put a turn and kick. Unfortenately a little 'mistake' made by the multiple times champion. Alright we go and get the thing back together! Viva Mexico! Another tromendous performance from both!
  • Jon Bones Jones came back to the octagon after 3 years and won the heavyweight champion by guillotining the french Ciryl Gane at the very first round. Too dominent to watch this fight. It did't even begin. LOL
  • UFC 286 is around the corner. You'd better fight!!!!

Haha. It's almost like a useful and weird skill to do so. Nonetheless, I barely see Trevor Noah doing this. Personally I ascribed this to his education given by his strict family members. Overall, It's a little bit okay for me to watch these actions on account of speciality.
  • Spent some time on the court, just for relaxing myself while listening the podcast "SanYanLiangYu vol.46"on google podcast.Hosts and guests were chatting on giving gifts between lovers:'The ceremony matters seriously...' Maybe you're right one, I cannot give you the things others can give. I'm the abnormal man, not fitting for you as others. It's only tough for me to find the right one. I'm okay with that then, cuz better to lead a life that I exzert for. Wait but I realize that sometimes falling into a relationship is kinda like scientific research: do relative surveys before you get into it and then plan to handle the experiments step by step on your own. Learning is endless. Next time it's better to understand how other girls see things before diving into a relationship...

ÊøÄÊ¥ªÈùûÊô∂ÊÄÅBiOxÂàÜÊï£Á∞á‰∏≠ÁöÑBi p-ËΩ®ÈÅìÁî®‰∫éÁîµÂÇ¨ÂåñÊ∞ÆËøòÂéü
Activating Bi p-orbitals in Dispersed Clusters of Amorphous BiOx for Electrocatalytic Nitrogen Reduction
Kang, Jianxin, Chen, Xiangyu, Si, Rutong, Gao, Xiang, Zhang, Shuo, Teobaldi, Gilberto, Selloni, Annabella, Liu, Li-Min, Guo, Lin, Angew. Chem. Int. Ed. 2023, e202217428; Angew. Chem. 2023, e202217428.
‚Ü©Ô∏è

BiÊ∞ßÂåñÊÄÅË¢´ÊèêÂá∫Âº∫ÁÉàÂΩ±ÂìçÂõ∫Ê∞ÆÊ¥ªÊÄßÔºåBi2+Á¶ªÂ≠êÁöÑÂçäÂç†pzËΩ®ÈÅìÂØπÁîµÂ≠êÊ≥®ÂÖ•ÊÉ∞ÊÄßN2ÂàÜÂ≠êÂÖ∑ÊúâÂæàÈ´òÁöÑÊïàÁéá„ÄÇ ÊúâË∂≥Â§üÁöÑÂÇ¨Âåñ‰ΩçÁÇπÊù•Âê∏ÈôÑÂíåÊøÄÊ¥ªN2ÔºåN2ÂíåÂÇ¨ÂåñÂâÇ‰πãÈó¥ÁöÑÈîÆÂêàÂèØ‰ª•Âéü‰ΩçËØÜÂà´„ÄÇ

Âú®ÂÖàÂâçÂê∏ÈôÑÁöÑBiOBrÁöÑÂéü‰ΩçÁîµÂåñÂ≠¶ÂàÜËß£‰πãÂêéÔºåÈÄöËøáBiÂú®Ê≤âÁßØËΩΩ‰Ωì‰∏äÁöÑËøÅÁßªÔºåÂ∑≤ÁªèÊàêÂäüÂú∞ÂÆûÁé∞‰∫ÜÊó†ÂÆöÂΩ¢BiOxÁöÑÂéüÂ≠êÁ∫ßÂàÜÊï£ÁöÑÁ∞áÔºåË°®Áé∞Âá∫‰∏çÂêåÁöÑBi2+ÂíåBi+Ê∞ßÂåñÊÄÅ„ÄÇÂÆûÈ™åÂíåÁêÜËÆ∫ËØÅÂÆûBiÁ≥ªÁªüÁöÑÊ¥ªÊÄß‰∏é6pËΩ®ÈÅìÁöÑÂ°´ÂÖÖÂíåÈöèÂêéBiÂéüÂ≠êÁöÑÊ∞ßÂåñÊÄÅÁõ¥Êé•Áõ∏ÂÖ≥„ÄÇ

  • ËØ•ÂÇ¨ÂåñÂâÇÂú®NH3Áîü‰∫ß‰∏≠Ë°®Áé∞Âá∫‰ºòÂºÇÁöÑÊ≥ïÊãâÁ¨¨ÊïàÁéáÔºà30%ÔºâÂíåÈ´ò‰∫ßÁéáÔºà113Œºg h-1mg-1catÔºâÔºå‰ºò‰∫éÂ§ßÂ§öÊï∞Áé∞ÊúâÁöÑÊ∞¥Ê∫∂Ê∂≤ÂÇ¨ÂåñÂâÇ„ÄÇ Ëøô‰∫õÁªìÊûú‰∏∫ÂºÄÂèëpÂµåÊÆµÂÖÉÁ¥†ÂÇ¨ÂåñÂ§öÁîµÂ≠êÂèçÂ∫îÁöÑÊΩúÂäõÂ•†ÂÆö‰∫ÜÂü∫Á°Ä„ÄÇÂ∑•‰ΩúÁõ∏ÂÖ≥ÁöÑËßÅËß£‰∏∫Êú™Êù•ÂºÄÂèëpËΩ®ÈÅìÂÖÉÁ¥†ÁöÑÂÖ®ÈÉ®ÊΩúÂäõÈì∫Âπ≥‰∫ÜÈÅìË∑ØÔºå‰ª•ÂÇ¨Âåñ‰ªéNRRÂºÄÂßãÁöÑÂ§öÁîµÂ≠êÂèçÂ∫îÔºå‰ΩÜ‰∏çÈôê‰∫éÊ≠§„ÄÇ

3Ô∏è‚É£ vacancy-defected graphene VG-CuNi-2 for detecting TCE

‚Ü©Ô∏è
A first-principles study of the adsorption of trichloroethylene on vacancy-defected graphene decorated by Cu and/or Ni dimers

üëë Fighters Countdown

‚Ü©Ô∏è
On 11th Feb 2023, UFC 284 will be held in Perth, a city located in the westsouth of Australia. The final show will be brought by P4P NO.1 Alex Volkanovski and P4P NO.2 Islam Makhachev. For the former, it's a treasurable chance to hold two division's championship belts simultaneously, for the latter, the aim is to take the P4P NO.1 position from his opponent, and defend his belt for the first time.

From my point of view, I'm gonna go for Islam. Similar to Olivira, Alex had been on the edge of failure at least twice before when he defended his champion against T-City and Max's challenges. Of course Alex won the games by showing his endurance and patience, but from the opponents' view, they made mistakes or did not have the top-level choke skills to stop Alex's pace. However, notably, Alex's speed is sterlingly quick and he's flexible with his one-shot power at the same time.
